content:
TITLE: Installing @dub/ui Library with pnpm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the @dub/ui React component library using pnpm package manager. This library contains shared UI components used across Dub.co web applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm i @dub/ui
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing @dub/utils with pnpm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the @dub/utils package using pnpm package manager. This library contains shared utility functions used across Dub.co applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/utils/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm i @dub/utils
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing @dub/embed-core Package with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the @dub/embed-core package using PNPM package manager. This package contains the core logic for embedding Dub's referral dashboard on third-party websites.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/embeds/core/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm i @dub/embed-core
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing @dub/embed-react Package with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the @dub/embed-react package using the PNPM package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/embeds/react/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm i @dub/embed-react
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Dub.co Tinybird Directory Structure in Bash
DESCRIPTION: A bash tree representation showing the organization of datasources, endpoints, and pipes used in the Dub.co Tinybird setup. The structure includes data sources for click events and metadata, analytics endpoints for different dimensions, and data processing pipes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/tinybird/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
├── datasources
│   └── dub_click_events.datasource
│   └── dub_click_events_mv.datasource
│   └── dub_links_metadata.datasource
│   └── dub_links_metadata_latest.datasource
├── endpoints
│   ├── browser.pipe
│   ├── city.pipe
│   ├── clicks.pipe
│   ├── country.pipe
│   ├── device.pipe
│   ├── os.pipe
│   └── referer.pipe
│   └── timeseries.pipe
│   └── top_links.pipe
│   └── top_urls.pipe
├── pipes
│   ├── dub_click_events_pipe.pipe
│   ├── dub_links_metadata_pipe.pipe
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Dub CLI Help Information
DESCRIPTION: Command to view the help documentation for available Dub CLI commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm start help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Dub CLI Installation
DESCRIPTION: Command to verify the Dub CLI installation by checking its version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
dub -v
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dub CLI Commands in Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Dub CLI commands in a production-like environment after global installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
dub [command]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Dub CLI for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Dub CLI package for production use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking Dub CLI Globally
DESCRIPTION: Command to link the Dub CLI package globally for system-wide access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm link
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dub CLI Commands in Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Dub CLI commands during local development using the start script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm start [command]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Stripe App Locally
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Stripe app in local development mode. This is used when testing the app before publishing a new version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/stripe-app/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
stripe apps start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Dub CLI in Watch Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Dub CLI package in watch mode for development purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to CLI Directory for Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to navigate to the CLI package directory for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/packages/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd packages/cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Applying GNU AGPL License Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: Template text to include at the beginning of source files to apply the GNU AGPL license. This notice includes placeholders for program name, copyright year, and author name, along with standard license text explaining redistribution rights and warranty disclaimers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dubinc/dub/blob/main/LICENSE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
<one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published
by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU Affero General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
```
